basics.name: Yao-Ting, Huang
basics.summary: Yao-Ting Huang is an M.S. student in ECE at University of California, San Diego working in the Advanced Robotics and Controls Lab under the advisement of Michael Yip. He develops complete visuotactile teleoperation systems—including firmware, communication protocols, simulation setup, force-feedback computation, and kinematic modelling—to generate high-fidelity demonstration data. His research spans visuotactile policy learning, multimodal sensor fusion (vision, force, tactile), and data-efficient imitation and reinforcement learning tailored to contact-rich, dexterous manipulation tasks in simulation and reality. Currently, two related works have been submitted to ICRA 2026 as he prepares to apply for a fall 2026 PhD focused on robotics, RL, and dexterous manipulation.

work.name: Industrial Technology Research Institute(ITRI)
work.summary: Contributed to the self-driving automobile group by applying reinforcement learning for behavioral prediction of autonomous vehicles. And designed a virtual training environment for reinforcement learning framework based on real-world collected vehicle data.
